children.subject: i recommend both, cs61c is more ee related tho

history.content:
Both hard classes, but I'd choose 61C over 70 for taking over the summer, because 70 is more conceptually challenging and it might be harder to grasp all the concepts well when you're doing them twice as quickly as a normal semester. I did 61C over the summer, and while it was time consuming it was totally doable as long as you have a pretty open summer (definitely don't plan on doing an internship AND 61C, for example).

I'd also like to disagree with Anon, the only areas 61c would come in handy for in EE would be courses on computer architecture. CS 70 would be crucial for any class in signals/control  (i.e. EE 120) or networks/communication systems (these classes don't seem to be offered too often but EECS 126 for example). For circuits/devices classes neither class is particularly important, more important to know 16B.

children.subject:
CS 61C gives essential preparation for digital circuits / microarchitecture concepts in EECS 151, but other than that is only particularly important if you intend to do circuits/VLSI/architecture. The real natural follow-on to 61C is CS 152 (architecture), which isn't an EE class. 

CS 70 is essential regardless of what you do in EECS, but it won't specifically prepare you for much more than information theory. 

Having been involved with course staff for both courses, I'd say to just take whichever one you feel comfortable with, since it's difficult managing the pace of a summer course regardless. As a grad student in circuits, I will also tell you that none of the lower divs prepare students particularly well for circuits/devices upper divs, so you can't really go wrong (or right) if that's what you'd like to explore down the road.

I would vote for cs70. I took cs70 this summer, and it was a nice experience focusing on only one course over the summer. Although the course went very fast, the instructors were caring. And you have a chance to link everything together because you have a fresh memory.

history.content: I need to take one of these classes over summer to declare the EECS major, but am not sure which one. Do people recommend one over the other? (I plan to go down the EE path after declaring EECS)
history.subject: 61C or CS70 over summer?
